_source.text: [11] We are of the opinion that this kind of analysis is generally only required in a nuisance case, and that it is better to preserve that aspect of traditional trespass analysis requiring no proof of actual injury because the invasion of the plaintiff's right to exclude was regarded as tortious by itself.
